io.werval.spi

Interface ApplicationSPI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Application 

    public interface ApplicationSPI
extends Application
    Application SPI.

    Intended for use by HttpServer implementations, the DevShell and Application unit tests.

    Don't use in your Application code.

        activate, cache, classLoader, config, crypto, defaultCharset, errors, executor, executors, isActive, langs, metaData, mimeTypes, mode, parameterBinders, passivate, plugin, plugins, reverseRoutes, routes, sourceFileURLGenerator, templates, tmpdir

    • Method Detail

      • global

        Global global()
        Application Global object.

        The Application Global object should not be accessed by Application code, that's why this accessor is in ApplicationSPI only.

        Returns:
        Application Global object

      • events

        EventsSPI events()
        Application Events SPI.
        Specified by:
        events in interface  Application
        Returns:
        Application Events SPI

      • httpBuilders

        HttpBuildersSPI httpBuilders()
        HTTP API Objects Builders SPI.

        Use this to create instances of HTTP API Objects found in the io.werval.api.http package. All builders are immutable and reusable.

        Specified by:
        httpBuilders in interface  Application
        Returns:
        HTTP API Objects Builders SPI

      • onHttpRequestComplete

        void onHttpRequestComplete(RequestHeader requestHeader)
        Callback for completed HTTP requests.

        Called once the whole response has been sent to the client.

        Parameters:
        requestHeader - Original request header

      • shuttingDownOutcome

        CompletableFuture<Outcome> shuttingDownOutcome(ProtocolVersion version,
                                               String requestIdentity)
        Build the Outcome of any request happening while shutting down.

        This should return a 503 Service Unavailable status and a wisely choosen Retry-After header.

        Parameters:
        version - Protocol version of the HTTP request
        requestIdentity - Identity of the HTTP request
        Returns:
        Future of shutting down Outcome

      • reload

        void reload(ClassLoader newClassLoader)
        Reload Application with a new ClassLoader.
        Parameters:
        newClassLoader - New Application ClassLoader
